channel.title: Comments on: Logging JavaScript Errors to OpenLog

item.title: By: stritti
item.dc:creator: stritti
item.description: <p>Probably you are also interested in log4js ( <a href="<a rel="nofollow" href="http://log4js.berlios.de""/ rel="nofollow ugc">http://log4js.berlios.de"</a> rel="nofollow"><a href="http://log4js.berlios.de"/ rel="nofollow ugc">http://log4js.berlios.de</a></a> ) a logging API for JavaScript.</p>
item.content:encoded: Probably you are also interested in log4js ( http://log4js.berlios.de/“ rel=”nofollow”>http://log4js.berlios.de/ ) a logging API for JavaScript.

item.title: By: Ben Poole
item.dc:creator: Ben Poole
item.description: <p>That's really very cool, and this sort of thing will only become more important as Javascript gets used more and more in apps.</p><p>Splendid!</p>
item.content:encoded:
That’s really very cool, and this sort of thing will only become more important as Javascript gets used more and more in apps.

Splendid!

item.title: By: Julian Robichaux
item.dc:creator: Julian Robichaux
item.description: <p>That's fantastic! I think that code belongs in the next production version of the code. I'll see about working it in and I'll send you an e-mail offline so we can chat about it. Thanks!</p><p>- Julian</p>
item.content:encoded:
That’s fantastic! I think that code belongs in the next production version of the code. I’ll see about working it in and I’ll send you an e-mail offline so we can chat about it. Thanks!

– Julian
